thread.title: Tottenham midfielder Dele Alli handed three game ban following Europa League red card
thread.title_full: Tottenham midfielder Dele Alli handed three game ban following Europa League red card

author: John Cross
title: Tottenham midfielder Dele Alli handed three game ban following Europa League red card
text:
Sport Tottenham midfielder Dele Alli handed three game ban following Europa League red card It means Alli will miss half of Tottenham's Champions League Group stage campaign if they reach UEFA's top competition next season Share Dele Alli hangs his head as he leaves the pitch after being sent off (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Tottenham midfielder Dele Alli has been hit with a three game Euro ban after his red card against Wembley last month. 
It means Alli will miss half of Tottenham's Champions League Group stage campaign if they reach UEFA's top competition next season. 
It is a big punishment by UEFA designed to send a strong message after Alli's tackle on Brecht Dejaegere. 
Alli apologised afterwards and Tottenham tried to argue down the punishment this week but UEFA's Control, Ethics and disciplinary Board dished out the punishment. Alli flies in for the tackle (Photo: PA) Alli is shown a red card (Photo: Reuters) 
The UEFA statement read: "UEFA Europa League round of 32 match between Tottenham Hotspur FC and KAA Gent (2-2), played on 23 February in London, England. 
"Decision: Tottenham Hotspur FC player Dele Alli has been suspended for three (3) UEFA competition matches for which he would otherwise be eligible. 
"The charges related to a red card given to Dele Alli during the match." Like us on Facebook
